metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1990 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in ndlc_remove in drivers/nfc/st-nci/ndlc.c in the Linux Kernel. This flaw could allow an attacker to crash the system due to a race problem. It was discovered that the ST NCI NFC driver did not properly handle device removal events. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1990` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-generic - 4.4.0-242.276
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-242-lowlatency - 4.4.0-242.276
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1158-aws - 4.4.0-1158.173
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1159.172~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-242.276').
